alert.note: Alert for East Carroll; Madison (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 14 at 12:55AM CST until December 14 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern East Carroll Parish in northeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Madison Parish in northeastern Louisiana... Central Issaquena County in west central Mississippi... Southern Sharkey County in west central Mississippi... Northwestern Warren County in west central Mississippi... * Until 400 AM CST. * At 1255 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tallulah, Valley Park, Omega, Sondheimer, Alsatia, Mansford, Eagle Bend, Fitler, Onward, Tendal, Waverly and Cary. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
